content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Magdeburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello, Mr. Abbasi. I'm glad you're interested in my apartment. I'm sure you'll find it to be an excellent place to live. So, how much are you willing to pay for the rent?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I would like to offer 400 Euros per month.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: I'm sorry, but that's much lower than what I'm looking for. I'm sure you understand that the location and quality of the apartment justify a higher price. How about we start with 550 Euros per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds like a good starting point. Since the apartment is unfurnished, I would expect it to be cheaper. I propose we meet in the middle at 475 Euros and call it a deal.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: I'm sorry, but I can't go that low. The apartment is brand new and in a prime location. I'm looking for a tenant who appreciates the value of the property. How about 525 Euros per month? It's a fair compromise.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of [475] Euro!
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: I'm sorry, but I can't accept that price. The apartment is in high demand, and I'm sure another tenant would be willing to pay a higher price. If you're not willing to pay a fair price, I'd rather keep looking for a tenant who appreciates the value of this property.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because [the price offered is too low for the value of the property].
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: I understand your position, Mr. Schmidt. I appreciate the time you've given me to consider your offer. If you find a tenant willing to pay more, I wish you all the best. TERMINATE
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
